intro: Hieracium psarellum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Hieracium psarellum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habit.
